meanings.definition: To send or convey from one person or place to another.
meanings.sent1: The radio tower transmits music to the entire town.
meanings.sent2: The phone transmits your voice to the person on the other end.
meanings.sent3: The magical wand transmits happiness wherever it goes.
meanings.sent4: Her smile transmits warmth to everyone she meets.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse transmits light to guide ships safely to shore.

meanings.definition: To pass on or spread (a disease, infection, etc.).
meanings.sent1: Mosquitoes can transmit malaria to humans through their bites.
meanings.sent2: Coughing and sneezing can transmit the flu virus to others.
meanings.sent3: The sneezing teddy bear transmits giggles to everyone around.
meanings.sent4: Gossip can transmit rumors faster than wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The wind can transmit pollen from one flower to another, aiding in pollination.

meanings.definition: To broadcast or send out (signals, messages, etc.).
meanings.sent1: The TV station transmits news updates to viewers across the country.
meanings.sent2: The satellite transmits data to the research center in real-time.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous parrot transmits secret messages to its bird friends.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse transmits signals to warn ships of dangerous rocks.
meanings.sent5: The radio tower transmits emergency alerts to keep the community safe.
